snippet: The decision to have just one class of stock marks a big change from the big Internet I.P.O.’s of the last several years, which aimed to preserve control for the company’s founders.
abstract: The decision to have just one class of stock marks a big change from the big Internet I.P.O.’s of the last several years, which aimed to preserve control for the company’s founders.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

headline.main: Breaking From Recent Tech Tradition, Twitter Forgoes Multiple Stock Classes
